materials.raw_text: Hg: 50 g, Nd: 30 g, Pr: 40 g, Sc: 20 g, Si: 100 g

sourcing.instructions: Hg: Chemical suppliers (ensure proper safety protocols), Nd: Rare earth metal suppliers, Pr: Rare earth metal suppliers, Sc: Rare earth metal suppliers, Si: Electronics or chemical supply stores
steps: Hg: Chemical suppliers (ensure proper safety protocols), Nd: Rare earth metal suppliers, Pr: Rare earth metal suppliers, Sc: Rare earth metal suppliers, Si: Electronics or chemical supply stores

1. Gather all materials in a clean, dry workspace. 2. Weigh each ingredient using an analytical balance for precision. 3. In a ceramic or glass container, carefully combine the weighed amounts of Hg, Nd, Pr, Sc, and Si. 4. Mix thoroughly using a glass rod or similar tool until a uniform mixture is achieved.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Gather all materials in a clean, dry workspace. 2. Weigh each ingredient using an analytical balance for precision. 3. In a ceramic or glass container, carefully combine the weighed amounts of Hg, Nd, Pr, Sc, and Si. 4. Mix thoroughly using a glass rod or similar tool until a uniform mixture is achieved.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixture into a high-temperature crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat the mixture gradually to 1000°C at a rate of 10°C/min. 4. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and melting of the components.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixture into a high-temperature crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat the mixture gradually to 1000°C at a rate of 10°C/min. 4. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and melting of the components.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 25°C) over 4-6 hours. 2. Do not open the furnace until it has reached a safe temperature to prevent oxidation or contamination.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 25°C) over 4-6 hours. 2. Do not open the furnace until it has reached a safe temperature to prevent oxidation or contamination.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Sand the edges and surfaces with fine grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant or protective coating depending on the intended use of the material.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Sand the edges and surfaces with fine grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant or protective coating depending on the intended use of the material.
